Definition: Kaposi sarcoma is a type of cancer that causes lesions in the skin, lymph nodes, and other organs.
Symptoms: Purple or brown lesions on the skin, swelling, and pain.
Diagnosis: Biopsy of lesions and imaging studies.
Treatment: Antiviral medications, chemotherapy, and radiation therapy.

Definition: A keloid scar is a thick, raised scar that forms at the site of an injury or incision.
Causes: Genetic predisposition and excessive collagen production during healing.
Symptoms: Raised, firm scar that may be itchy or painful.
Treatment: Corticosteroid injections, silicone sheets, and surgical removal.

Definition: Kidney cancer is a type of cancer that originates in the kidneys.
Symptoms: Blood in urine, flank pain, and unexplained weight loss.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies, urine tests, and biopsy.

Definition: Kidney stones are hard deposits made of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys.
Causes: Dehydration, dietary factors, and certain medical conditions.
Symptoms: Severe pain in the back or side, blood in urine, and frequent urination.
Treatment: Increased fluid intake, pain management, and sometimes surgery.

condition: Knee MCL Injury (Medial Collateral Ligament Injury)

Definition: A knee MCL injury is a sprain or tear of the medial collateral ligament in the knee.
Causes: Direct impact to the outer knee or sudden twisting motions.
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, and instability in the knee.
Treatment: Rest, ice, compression, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Knee pain is discomfort in or around the knee joint.
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, stiffness, and reduced range of motion.
Diagnosis: Physical examination, medical history, and imaging studies.
Treatment: Pain relievers, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: A kneecap dislocation occurs when the patella (kneecap) slips out of its normal position.
Causes: Trauma, sports injuries, and anatomical factors.
Symptoms: Visible deformity, pain, and inability to move the knee.
Treatment: Reduction (realigning the kneecap), immobilization, and rehabilitation.

Definition: Knock knee deformity is a condition where the knees angle in and touch each other when standing.
Causes: Genetic factors, nutritional deficiencies, and certain medical conditions.
Symptoms: Knees touching while standing, difficulty walking, and knee pain.
Treatment: Observation, physical therapy, and in severe cases, surgery.

Definition: Kyphosis is an excessive curvature of the spine, resulting in a hunchback appearance.
Causes: Degenerative diseases, developmental issues, and osteoporosis.
Symptoms: Back pain, stiffness, and visible curvature of the spine.
Treatment: Physical therapy, bracing, and surgery in severe cases.
